title: Implement __mul__ for Value
description: Add the `__mul__` method to Value so that `Value(2) * Value(3)` returns `Value(6)` with `_op='*'` and correct children.
testCode:
try:
    a = Value(3.0)
    b = Value(4.0)
    c = a * b
    assert c.data == 12.0
    print("PASS: Value(3) * Value(4) has data == 12")
except:
    print("FAIL: Value(3) * Value(4) has data == 12")

try:
    a = Value(3.0)
    b = Value(4.0)
    c = a * b
    assert c._op == '*'
    print("PASS: Value(3) * Value(4) has _op == '*'")
except:
    print("FAIL: Value(3) * Value(4) has _op == '*'")

try:
    a = Value(3.0)
    b = Value(4.0)
    c = a * b
    assert len(c._children) == 2
    print("PASS: Value(3) * Value(4) has 2 children")
except:
    print("FAIL: Value(3) * Value(4) has 2 children")

try:
    a = Value(3.0)
    c = a * 2
    assert c.data == 6.0
    print("PASS: Value(3) * 2 has data == 6")
except:
    print("FAIL: Value(3) * 2 has data == 6")
hints: Same pattern as __add__ but with multiplication
Don't forget to handle plain numbers
